title: PHV Driver’s Licence - Responsibilities and Road Safety

questions.question: What is the primary duty of a PHV driver towards passengers?
options: To drive as fast as possible
To ensure safety, comfort, and professionalism
To decide the best route without consultation
To negotiate fares with passengers
questions.answer: To ensure safety, comfort, and professionalism

questions.question: Which of the following is a legal requirement for PHV drivers?
options: Wearing a company uniform
Holding a valid PHV driver’s licence
Offering discounts on fares
Providing passengers with water bottles
questions.answer: Holding a valid PHV driver’s licence

questions.question: What must a PHV driver do if they receive a penalty notice while driving?
options: Ignore it
Report it to their operator and pay if required
Wait until licence renewal to address it
Ask the passenger to pay it
questions.answer: Report it to their operator and pay if required

questions.question: Under which circumstance can a PHV driver refuse service?
options: If the passenger is abusive or poses a threat
If the journey is too short
If the passenger requests a different route
If the passenger is carrying luggage
questions.answer: If the passenger is abusive or poses a threat

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of unprofessional conduct?
options: Speaking politely to passengers
Overcharging passengers without justification
Driving carefully and legally
Assisting passengers with mobility issues
questions.answer: Overcharging passengers without justification

questions.question: How should PHV drivers assist visually impaired passengers?
options: Refuse service to those with guide dogs
Offer guidance and allow guide dogs in the vehicle
Charge extra for service animals
Ignore them and wait for another passenger
questions.answer: Offer guidance and allow guide dogs in the vehicle

questions.question: What is the purpose of displaying a PHV licence disc?
options: To inform passengers of the driver’s personal details
To show proof of licensing and compliance
To indicate the driver’s preferred fares
To allow the driver to work anywhere in the UK
questions.answer: To show proof of licensing and compliance

questions.question: What should a PHV driver do if a passenger requests an unplanned stop?
options: Refuse immediately
Assess safety, legality, and inform the operator if necessary
Charge extra without notifying the passenger
Only allow stops at petrol stations
questions.answer: Assess safety, legality, and inform the operator if necessary

questions.question: What is the consequence of failing to renew a PHV licence on time?
options: A small fine but continued operation
Immediate suspension from work
A warning letter with no penalty
Extension until renewal is processed
questions.answer: Immediate suspension from work

questions.question: What should PHV drivers do if their vehicle’s insurance expires?
options: Continue working until caught
Renew the insurance before accepting passengers
Only accept cash payments to avoid detection
Use a different vehicle without notifying authorities
questions.answer: Renew the insurance before accepting passengers

questions.question: What must PHV drivers do if their vehicle is involved in an accident?
options: Immediately leave the scene
Exchange details and report to authorities if necessary
Continue the journey if the vehicle is still working
Blame the passenger if they were distracting the driver
questions.answer: Exchange details and report to authorities if necessary

questions.question: Which of these actions is NOT a professional expectation of PHV drivers?
options: Keeping their vehicle clean and roadworthy
Providing a professional and polite service
Engaging in long personal conversations with passengers
Following traffic rules at all times
questions.answer: Engaging in long personal conversations with passengers

questions.question: When is a PHV driver allowed to use a mobile phone?
options: Only when making personal calls
Only when using a hands-free device
While stationary at a red light
Whenever they need to check directions
questions.answer: Only when using a hands-free device

questions.question: Which of the following actions can lead to a PHV driver’s licence being revoked?
options: Receiving multiple customer complaints
Having an unclean vehicle
Using a hands-free navigation system
Following speed limits too strictly
questions.answer: Receiving multiple customer complaints

questions.question: What should a PHV driver do if their vehicle is stolen?
options: Wait to see if it is returned
Report it immediately to the police and their operator
Claim insurance first before reporting
Borrow another vehicle without informing authorities
questions.answer: Report it immediately to the police and their operator

questions.question: What must a PHV driver do before working with a new operator?
options: Ensure they are registered with TfL
Only notify their previous employer
Stop working until a new badge is issued
Submit a complaint against their previous operator
questions.answer: Ensure they are registered with TfL

questions.question: Which of these is a key environmental responsibility of PHV drivers?
options: Driving as fast as possible to reduce journey times
Minimizing unnecessary engine idling
Using the air conditioning at all times
Only driving at night to avoid traffic
questions.answer: Minimizing unnecessary engine idling

questions.question: How can PHV drivers reduce their carbon footprint?
options: Driving aggressively to reach destinations quickly
Maintaining proper vehicle servicing and smooth driving
Only driving petrol vehicles
Avoiding public transport users
questions.answer: Maintaining proper vehicle servicing and smooth driving

questions.question: What must a PHV driver do if a passenger becomes ill during a journey?
options: Continue driving unless asked to stop
Stop safely and offer assistance
Ignore the passenger’s condition
Drop them off immediately, regardless of location
questions.answer: Stop safely and offer assistance

questions.question: Which of the following must a PHV driver report to TfL?
options: A minor argument with a passenger
A conviction or any legal penalty
A lost item found in the vehicle
A passenger changing their destination
questions.answer: A conviction or any legal penalty

questions.question: What may affect the environment around the operating centre?
options: Noise
Traffic & customer movement
Reading a book in your vehicle while stationary with engine off
None of the above
questions.answer: Traffic & customer movement

questions.question: Vehicles must be kept in good condition. If you own your PHV, you must tell TfL within 72 hours of any collision that affects the safety, performance, appearance or comfort of the vehicle. Which one of the following statements is correct?
options: You don’t need to inform TfL of any collision
You must tell TfL within 72 hours of any collision that affects the safety, performance, appearance or comfort of the vehicle.
You must inform your insurance and the operator of any collision
You only need to inform TfL if the vehicle cannot be driven
questions.answer: You must tell TfL within 72 hours of any collision that affects the safety, performance, appearance or comfort of the vehicle.

questions.question: Ridesharing is when?
options: People who do not know each other pay separate fares and travel in different vehicles
People who do not know each other pay separate fares and travel together in the same vehicle
Passengers change to another PHV during their trip
Passengers share one vehicle and split the cost between themselves
questions.answer: People who do not know each other pay separate fares and travel together in the same vehicle

questions.question: Is it illegal to keep your engine running while you are waiting?
options: Yes, this can be illegal on a public road
No, you can keep your engine running at all times
Yes, this is a criminal offense
Only in certain areas, such as near schools
questions.answer: Yes, this can be illegal on a public road

questions.question: TfL believes it is important to provide a public transport system which?
options: Is the fastest in the world
Is most expensive in the world
All people can use, so that older and disabled people have the same opportunities to travel as all other people
Only serves people in major cities
questions.answer: All people can use, so that older and disabled people have the same opportunities to travel as all other people

questions.question: You must never, for any reason, stop within?
options: Pedestrian clearways & zig-zag lines
Bus stops with wide red lines
Designated parking bays
Private driveways
questions.answer: Pedestrian clearways & zig-zag lines

questions.question: Do you need a British Passport to apply to PHV Driver's License?
options: Yes
No, but you must have the right to live and work in the UK
Only British or European Union Passports are accepted
Yes, and it must be valid for at least 5 years
questions.answer: No, but you must have the right to live and work in the UK

questions.question: Safeguarding means protecting children and adults at risk (sometimes called vulnerable adults) from?
options: Debt
Everyday life
Harm and abuse
Traffic accidents
questions.answer: Harm and abuse

questions.question: Not to behave in an anti-social manner means?
options: Not to leave litter in the street or road, not to go to the toilet in a public place
Not to leave your engine running
To accept bookings from strangers on the street
To always refuse bookings from passengers
questions.answer: Not to leave litter in the street or road, not to go to the toilet in a public place

questions.question: All ridesharing journeys must be booked with:
options: Uber
A licensed London PHV operator
Bolt
Any taxi or PHV driver on the street
questions.answer: A licensed London PHV operator

questions.question: TfL expects PHV drivers to deliver?
options: Parcels
A high standard of customer service to all passengers, whatever their needs
Uber eats orders
Free rides to elderly passengers
questions.answer: A high standard of customer service to all passengers, whatever their needs

questions.question: Can TfL take licensing action against you if you stop or park on a taxi rank?
options: Only if parked for longer than 5 minutes
Yes
Only if you leave your vehicle unattended
No, taxi ranks can be used by PHVs after 10pm
questions.answer: Yes

questions.question: Red route signs - meaning?
options: Only loading may take place at the time shown for up to a maximum
No stopping at any time
No stopping between 10am and 4pm
Stopping is allowed only for taxis
questions.answer: No stopping at any time

questions.question: As a PHV driver, you are expected to be fully aware of and to obey the rules of the road as explained in the?
options: DVLA Driver Code
Traffic Code
Highway Code
TfL PHV Driver Guide
questions.answer: Highway Code

questions.question: In what circumstances are you allowed to use your private car when your London licensed PHV vehicle breaks down?
options: Only if your operator allows you to do so
Only if your operator allows you to do so and the job was pre-booked
You are not allowed to use any unlicensed vehicles to carry out bookings
You can use your private car for emergency bookings only
questions.answer: You are not allowed to use any unlicensed vehicles to carry out bookings

questions.question: When driving, you must be aware of your responsibilities under?
options: The Code of Conduct
The Driver Code
The Highway Code
PHV Operating Rules
questions.answer: The Highway Code

questions.question: A child is a person under the age of?
options: 17 Years
16 Years
18 Years
14 Years
questions.answer: 18 Years

questions.question: Name the road sign?
options: Taxi Lane
Bus Lane
Cycle Lane
No Entry
questions.answer: Bus Lane

questions.question: Can you get a PCN if you wait for a late passenger somewhere where there are restrictions?
options: No, as long as you have a booking
Yes, at all times
Only between 6am and 10pm
Only if you leave your vehicle unattended
questions.answer: Yes, at all times

questions.question: TfL expects all licensed drivers to offer Londoners and visitors?
options: Bottled water
Professional and safe service
Free rides
Discounted fares
questions.answer: Professional and safe service

questions.question: If there are waiting or parking restrictions, what can you do?
options: You can stop for up to 5 minutes
You can stop for no longer than is needed for the passenger to get in or out of the vehicle
You can stop for up to 2 minutes
You can stop for as long as needed if you keep the engine running
questions.answer: You can stop for no longer than is needed for the passenger to get in or out of the vehicle

questions.question: When can a replacement vehicle licence disc be issued?
options: When you take the original discs off for holiday
When the original discs are lost or stolen
When the original discs are damaged
When your PHV is off-road for maintenance
questions.answer: When the original discs are lost or stolen

questions.question: You can only carry out ridesharing bookings that you have received from?
options: Directly from the passenger
Uber
A licensed London PHV operator
Any ride-sharing app
questions.answer: A licensed London PHV operator

questions.question: Do operators need to keep details of complaints made to them?
options: Yes, details of all complaints
Yes, but only details of complaints involving violent or aggressive behaviour
No
Only for complaints from corporate clients
questions.answer: Yes, details of all complaints

questions.question: How to recognise a London licensed PHV vehicle?
options: By PHV licence discs on display
By a Taxi sign on the roof
By Uber logo on the doors
By the vehicle's registration number
questions.answer: By PHV licence discs on display

questions.question: What type of behaviour should be avoided?
options: That causes any danger to you or others around you
That causes any danger to you only
That is safe and follows the rules from The Highway Code
That causes minor inconvenience to other drivers
questions.answer: That causes any danger to you or others around you

questions.question: To provide the best services to your passengers you should?
options: Drive fast
Always ask your passengers if they need any help and wait for your offer to be accepted
Play loud music
Offer them discounts on their rides
questions.answer: Always ask your passengers if they need any help and wait for your offer to be accepted

questions.question: Operators must report the following types of complaints to the police?
options: Operators are not required to notify the police about any type of complaints
They must report all complaints to the police
Any complaints that involve possible crimes
Only complaints involving damage to vehicles
questions.answer: Any complaints that involve possible crimes

questions.question: You can only carry out bookings received from?
options: Any UK licensed operator
London licensed PHV operator
Anyone looking for a cab on the street or at stations or airports
Customers who contact you directly
questions.answer: London licensed PHV operator

questions.question: How many years must you have held your driving license before applying for PHV Driver's license?
options: 3 Years
5 Years
There is no limit
1 Year
questions.answer: 3 Years
